items.title: Robin Guenther, Architect of Healthy Hospitals, Dies at 68
items.abstract: Supporting the use of nontoxic construction materials, she co-wrote the first guide to building green health care facilities and designed them to be less austere.

items.title: The Environmental Legacy of the Steel City
items.abstract: A group of photographers documenting environmental issues around air quality control in Pittsburgh hopes their images will spur others to action.

items.title: Urban Schools Aim for Environmental Revolution
items.abstract: Six big-city school systems are combining their purchasing power to persuade suppliers to sell healthier and more environment-friendly products, like compostable food trays, at low prices.

items.title: City Housing Projects Call For Environmental Help
items.abstract: Housing project residents say the city encouraged them to “go green,” but did little to help them and in some circumstances, stood in their way.

items.title: Environmental Report Details Heat’s Costly Escape Through Elevator Shafts
items.abstract: Elevator shafts accounted for much of the heat loss in New York City buildings, leaks that cost owners money and have detrimental environmental effects, according to a study by the Urban Green Council.
